circumstances: While in cruising altitude on a taxi flight from Norfolk to Roanoke, the pilot informed ATC about a double engine failure and elected to divert to the nearest airport. Shortly later, he decided to attempt an emergency landing when the airplane crashed in an open field. Both occupants were slightly injured and the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Douglas engine failure in flight due to inadequate preflight preparation on part of the pilot. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Mismanagement of fuel, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Powerplant-instruments: fuel quantity gauge, improperly alignment/adjustment, 
- Forces landing off airport on land, 
- Fuel gauges read 1/8 full, tanks empty.
